questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'The coffee is _______ hot to drink.'
Spot the mistake: 'There's enough many people in the room.'
Change the sentence to include 'too' or 'enough': 'The water is cold.'
questions.answer: The water is too cold to swim in.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'I don't have _______ money to buy the dress.'
Spot the mistake: 'It's enough hot today.'
Change the sentence to include 'too' or 'enough': 'The soup is hot.'
questions.answer: The soup is too hot to eat.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'She is _______ young to get married.'
Spot the mistake: 'This room is enough small for us.'
Change the sentence to include 'too' or 'enough': 'I have money.'
questions.answer: I have enough money to travel.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'The test wasn't _______ hard for me.'
Spot the mistake: 'The music is too low to dancing.'
Change the sentence to include 'too' or 'enough': 'The suitcase is heavy.'
questions.answer: The suitcase is too heavy to carry.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'She doesn't have _______ experience for the job.'
Spot the mistake: 'He's too tired for not going to bed.'
Change the sentence to include 'too' or 'enough': 'The weather is good.'
questions.answer: The weather is good enough for a picnic.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'The chili is _______ spicy for me.'
Spot the mistake: 'We have too many time.'
Change the sentence to include 'too' or 'enough': 'The room is warm.'
questions.answer: The room is warm enough to sit in.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'I didn't drink _______ water and now I'm thirsty.'
Spot the mistake: 'The book is too interesting to not read it.'
questions.answer: to not read it (not to read)
